intro: Eberlanzia stylosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed eberlanzia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Eberlanzia stylosa produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
